answers.answer: Hi,The staphylococci are usually found in the skin, so it is moot to try and find where you actually got it. If your daughter is in good health, she would likely not have any problems with holding your hand or a hug,  though of course, washing your hands is really the best way to prevent infections.Coag negative staphylococci should be handled with antibiotics. Of course, any misuse of antibiotics may promote resistance.What is more important is that, men don't usually get urinary tract infections and maybe you need to find out why you got it. Best discuss this with your doctor, among the things to consider would be a systemic disease like diabetes, some obstruction due to a subclinical prostatic enlargement.
